body: Can you test this on `main`? @ickshonpe has done a great job fixing a number of small bugs.
FYI @nicoburns; this may be a taffy bug instead.

> Can you test this on main?

geeez, this might take a hot minute:

```
warning: `sickle_ui_scaffold` (lib) generated 2 warnings
error: could not compile `sickle_ui_scaffold` (lib) due to 178 previous errors; 2 warnings emitted
```
Well on the bright side the release candidate for 0.15 is slated for October 4th, so you can use this to start the migration ðŸ˜…

> Well on the bright side the release candidate for 0.15 is slated for October 4th, so you can use this to start the migration ðŸ˜…

`EntityCommands` consuming itself needs me to rewrite the entire library... again..., so it might take a while.

It's still a problem in main, I noticed this as well a day or two ago when I was working on improving `Overflow` support. It's not to do with Taffy, it's just that the renderer isn't adjusting the coordinates to account for clipping. This wasn't a problem in the border-radius implementation I wrote, I guess that part got lost in the adopted simplified version. I'll work out a fix.

Well, fixing all the build errors got me here, so I am afraid I won't be able to provide further input for the time being.

![Screenshot_226](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6f767fd4-77ff-43de-96e5-7ca9b8827467)

There are more problems as well, you can see them in this screenshot: It's from a modified version of the outlines examples where I added a border radius of 25px to the images. The outlines should be cut off by the clipping not wrapping the visible part of the image and the rendered border-radius is elliptical even though we don't support it.

rename.from: Border / raidus doesn't respect full Node size.
rename.to: Border / radius doesn't respect full Node size.
